ratings.question_text: Overall, how would you rate the workload of this course in comparison to other Yale courses you have taken:
What is your overall assessment of this course?
What is your overall rating of the primary instructor?
The primary instructor's sensitivity to students and ability to provide students with adequate feedback was:

narratives.question_text: Indicate the total number of hours per week (outside the classroom) you spent on this course:
comments: 8-12 hours /week
Variable by week. 2-10

narratives.question_text: Looking back on this course, what is your overall assessment of the course:  What are its strengths and weaknesses, and in what ways might it be improved?
comments: strengths: discussion, guest lecturers, final assignment designed by you

marney and dana were great, but the course didn't really seem to have a clear focus and the material became a little redundant. I learned a lot about why smoking is bad and how e-cigarettes are changing the field but not necessarily how policy and science intersect.
Loved the professors
I greatly enjoyed this class. I liked that it was laid back and we were able to pursue our own interests.
Great learning experience
The course is essentially a lecture series regarding research on tobacco regulation and current FDA power regarding tobacco products.

I enjoyed this seminar-style course. We learned about various tobacco related issues each week and then for homework we provided feedback on what we learned and developed quiz questions based on the lecture content.

narratives.question_text: Please evaluate the instructor of this course. What are the instructor's strengths and weaknesses, and in what ways might his or her teaching be improved?
comments: Instructor: Dana A Cavallo  strengths: approachable, great insight
Instructor: Dana A Cavallo  Great comments during discussions
Instructor: Dana A Cavallo  Dana was a good instructor and had a lot of great insights into the topic.
Instructor: Dana A Cavallo  Great teaching
Instructor: Dana A Cavallo  Dana is really great. She and Marney were a great team. I learned a lot in this course. I really think this is one the best courses i have taken so far at YSPH.
Instructor: Dana A Cavallo  Very caring and knowledgable about tobacco products and current e-cigarette use among youth
Instructor: Marney A. White  strengths: approachable, great insight, open to your ideas
Instructor: Marney A. White  Facilitated class discussion very well
Instructor: Marney A. White  Marney was fantastic and super responsive outside of class.
Instructor: Marney A. White  Great teaching
Instructor: Marney A. White  Marney is amazing and she really had a lot of experience with tobacco studies. I enjoyed attending this class and i learned a lot information.
Instructor: Marney A. White  Energetic and passionate about students engaging in class material

narratives.question_text: How would you summarize this course for a fellow student? Would you recommend it to another student? Why or why not?
comments: great grad student course and i would definitely recommend it because it gives you a lot of new/different information on a topic that has been a part of the public health field for decades

marney and dana were great, but the course didn't really seem to have a clear focus and the material became a little redundant. I learned a lot about why smoking is bad and how e-cigarettes are changing the field but not necessarily how policy and science intersect. take the course if you're really interested in the topic.
Great course
Yes, I would recommend this course to a fellow student.
Yes, will recommend

Excellent course. The course is really organized and was my best course at the school of public health so far. Marney and Dana had a lot of experience. They put a lot of energy and effort to make sure we had the best guest and best learning experience. I also recommend anyone in the AP program who is interested in tobacco control to take this course.

Most week you attend a 1 to 1:30 lecture and then complete assignments regarding the lecture. The class is being turned into an online course and thus the assignments are usually an evaluation of online material.

This course is structured the way all graduate level courses should be! You learn various material each week and then provide feedback on the lectures for homework. There are no tests or quizzes. Aside from the homework, which was not assigned every week, there was a final project.
